intro: Grastidium luzonense, commonly known as the Luzon grass. It is a flowering plant native to the Philippines, specifically found on the island of Luzon. The plant belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. Grastidium luzonense is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
